From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia




Upcoming film by Amar Kaushik


Stree 2PosterDirected byAmar KaushikWritten byNiren BhattProduced byDinesh VijanJyoti DeshpandeStarringShraddha KapoorRajkummar RaoPankaj TripathiAbhishek BanerjeeAparshakti KhuranaCinematographyJishnu BhattacharjeeMusic bySachin–JigarProductioncompaniesMaddock FilmsJio StudiosDistributed byPVR Inox PicturesRelease date
30 August 2024 (2024-08-30)
CountryIndiaLanguageHindi
Stree 2 (transl. Woman 2) is an upcoming Hindi language comedy horror film film directed by Amar Kaushik and produced by Dinesh Vijan and Jyoti Deshpande under the banner of Maddock Films and Jio Studios. A sequel to Stree (2018), it is the fourth installment in the Maddock Supernatural Universe. It stars Shraddha Kapoor, Rajkummar Rao, Pankaj Tripathi, Abhishek Banerjee and Aparshakti Khurana. The film is scheduled for theatrical release on 30 August 2024.[1][2][3]


Cast

Shraddha Kapoor as the unnamed woman
Rajkummar Rao as Vicky, a ladies tailor
Pankaj Tripathi as Rudra, a paranologist
Abhishek Banerjee as Jana
Aparshakti Khurana as Bittu
Varun Dhawan as Bhediya (special appearance)[4]
Tamannaah Bhatia (special appearance in a song)[5]

Production
Development
In October 2018, director Amar Kaushik announced his plans for a sequel to the Stree.[6] In February 2022, actor Rajkummar Rao confirmed the sequel's development.[7] In March 2023, the sequel entered the pre-production stage, with filming scheduled to commence in July 2023.[8][9] In April 2023, the makers announced that the film will release on 30 August 2024.[10] The cast include Shraddha Kapoor, Rajkummar Rao, Pankaj Tripathi, Abhishek Banerjee and Aparshakti Khurana, reprising their roles from the previous film.[11]

Filming
Principal photography commenced on 10 July 2023,[12] with the initial shoot held in Chanderi.[13] The second schedule began on same place in November 2023.[14]

Release
Theatrical
The film is scheduled to be theatrically released on 30 August 2024.[2]

Home Media
The film will premiere on Amazon Prime Video  after its theatrical run.[15]
